zone.line: Wagner
Ah when thus it thus in his museum conjured is,
And sees the world hardly one ( )
Hardly thro a telescope, nor of distant things
How shall it them thro persuasion lead?
Faust
?But If ?you you ?must not ?even feel, you will nought accomplish
If it nothing to the soul brings
And with artless aimiableness
The heart of ?the all hearers affects.
Sit you how ever! glued together
Burned a ragout of other feast
And blow the incommodious flames
To your ash-heap out!
The astonishment of children & apes
If you thereafter the delay stands
Then will ye not heart to hearts provide
When is you not of hearts gone
happiness
Wagner
Alone the proposition makes the Orator
I feel it well, yet am I far back
